item.title: 中国 1-2 月工业产出和零售销售均超预期
item.description: 中国的工厂产出在 1-2 月份加速增长并超出预期，这标志着 2024 年将有一个稳健的开端，并为那些寻求支撑摇摇欲坠的经济增长的政策制定者提供了暂时的宽慰。【原文：China's factory output sped up in the January-February period and beat expectations, marking a solid start for 2024 and offering tentative relief to policymakers who are seeking to shore up faltering economic growth.】

item.title: 中国 1-2 月房地产投资同比下降 9.0
item.description: 国家统计局（NBS）周一公布的数据显示，2024 年前两个月，中国房地产投资同比下降 9.0%，而 2023 年 12 月同比下降 24.0%。【原文：Property investment in China slid 9.0% year-on-year in the first two months of 2024, compared with a 24.0% fall in December 2023, National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) data showed on Monday.】

item.title: 中国 1-2 月工业产值增长 7%，超出预期
item.description: 周一的数据显示，1-2 月份中国工业产值同比增长 7.0%，增速高于 12 月份的 6.8%，超出预期，标志着 2024 年中国工业将有一个稳健的开端，这也让决策者暂时松了一口气。【原文：China's industrial output grew 7.0% year-on-year in the January-February period, data showed on Monday, accelerating from the 6.8% pace seen in December and beating expectations, marking a solid start for 2024 and offering tentative relief to policymakers.】

item.title: 日本央行政策转向在即，美元持稳，日元走软
item.description: 美元周一持稳，交易员们展望本周全球央行会议，日本央行似乎即将结束负利率，美联储预计降息多少次也成为焦点。【原文：The dollar was steady on Monday as traders looked ahead to a week dominated by central bank meetings worldwide, with the Bank of Japan seemingly on the brink of ending negative rates and the focus on how many rate cuts the Federal Reserve projects.】

item.title: 油价因供应收紧和地缘政治风险而上涨
item.description: 周一亚市早盘，油价上扬，巩固了上周因供应趋紧而上涨近4%的涨幅。【原文：Oil prices ticked up in early Asian trading on Monday, firming up gains from last week when prices rose nearly 4% on the view that supply was tightening.】

item.title: 亚洲股市闲庭信步，美元在央行红利到来前保持坚挺
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市低迷，美元坚挺，因为投资者希望在本周央行会议的雷区中穿行，本周日本可能结束自由货币政策，美国降息的步伐也可能放缓。【原文：Asian shares idled and the dollar held firm on Monday as investors looked to navigate a minefield of central bank meetings this week that could see the end of free money in Japan and perhaps a slower glide path for U.S. rate cuts.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称台积电考虑在日本建立先进芯片封装产能
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，台湾台积电正在考虑在日本建设先进的封装产能，此举将为日本重启半导体产业的努力增添动力。【原文：Taiwan's TSMC is looking at building advanced packaging capacity in Japan, according to two sources familiar with the matter, a move that would add momentum to Japan's efforts to reboot its semiconductor industry.】

item.title: 律师事务所称，优步将支付 1.78 亿美元解决与澳大利亚出租车司机的诉讼
item.description: 一家律师事务所周一表示，优步已同意支付 2.718 亿澳元（约合 1.783 亿美元），以解决出租车运营商和司机在澳大利亚提起的诉讼。【原文：Uber has agreed to pay A$271.8 million ($178.3 million) to settle a lawsuit in Australia brought by taxi operators and drivers, who alleged they lost income when the ride-hailing company moved into the country, a law firm said on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：神经紧绷，中国数据公布拉开关键一周的序幕
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称 Reddit 首次公开募股超额认购高达五倍
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周日表示，Reddit 的首次公开募股目前获得了四到五倍的超额认购，这使得该社交媒体平台更有可能达到其所寻求的 65 亿美元估值。【原文：Reddit's initial public offering is currently between four and five times oversubscribed, people familiar with the matter said on Sunday, making it more likely the social media platform will attain the $6.5 billion valuation it seeks.】

item.title: CERAWEEK：休斯顿能源会议上，石油兼并和清洁燃料备受关注
item.description: 本周，石油行业的高层管理人员和部长们将来到休斯顿，参加世界上最大的能源会议之一，这是因为大公司合并、油价稳定以及大规模转向清洁燃料的压力减小。【原文：Top oil executives and ministers descend on Houston this week for one of the world's biggest energy conferences emboldened by blockbuster mergers, stable oil prices and less pressure for a large scale move to clean fuels.】

item.title: 瑞士银行瑞银集团董事长表示，瑞银瞄准美国交易
item.description: 瑞士银行业巨头瑞银集团（UBS）主席周日告诉《新西兰报》，未来几年将在美国寻找并购机会。【原文：Swiss banking giant UBS will look for merger and acquisitions opportunities in the United States in the next few years, its chairman told the NZZ newspaper on Sunday.】

item.title: 在中国激烈的价格竞争中，新鹏将推出更便宜的电动车品牌
item.description: 中国电动汽车（EV）制造商新鹏宣布计划推出一个更廉价的品牌，在电动汽车行业激烈的价格竞争中进入一个高度竞争的细分市场。【原文：Chinese electric-vehicle (EV) maker Xpeng announced plans to launch a cheaper brand, entering a highly competitive segment amid an intense price competition in the EV industry.】

item.title: 特斯拉将提高 Model Y 在部分欧洲国家的价格
item.description: 特斯拉周六在社交媒体平台X上发文称，将于3月22日在欧洲一些国家上调Model Y汽车的价格，涨幅约为2000欧元（2177美元）或等值的当地货币。【原文：Tesla said in a post on social media platform X on Saturday that it would increase the price for its Model Y vehicles in a number of European countries on March 22 by approximately 2,000 euros ($2,177) or the equivalent in local currencies.】

item.title: 大亨德里帕斯卡称西方公司不应被迫出售俄罗斯资产
item.description: 俄罗斯亿万富翁奥列格-德里帕斯卡（Oleg Deripaska）表示，西方投资者不应迫于压力出售其在俄罗斯的资产，他认为这种做法是不诚实、短视的，而且对俄罗斯和全球经济有害。【原文：Russian billionaire Oleg Deripaska has said that Western investors should not be pressured to sell their Russian assets, a practice he said was dishonest, short-sighted and harmful to the Russian and global economies.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，马斯克的 SpaceX 公司正在为美国情报机构建设间谍卫星网络
item.description: 与美国国家侦察局签订的 18 亿美元合同显示了 SpaceX 在美国情报和军事项目中的参与程度，也说明五角大楼对旨在支持地面部队的大型低地球轨道卫星系统进行了更深入的投资。【原文：The $1.8 billion contract with the National Reconnaissance Office shows the extent of SpaceX's involvement in US intelligence and military projects and illustrates a deeper Pentagon investment into vast, low-Earth orbiting satellite systems aimed at supporting ground forces.】

item.title: 华为称奇瑞力狮 S7 的延期问题将在四月解决
item.description: 据当地媒体《财联社》周六报道，华为表示，半导体短缺和工厂搬迁问题导致其 Luxeed S7 轿车的生产和交付延迟的问题应从下月起得到解决。【原文：Huawei said that a shortage of semiconductors and factory relocation issues that had delayed production and deliveries of its Luxeed S7 sedan should be resolved from next month, local media outlet Cailianshe reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美国调查梅塔公司在毒品销售中的作用
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周六援引文件和熟知内情的人士的话报道，美国联邦当局正在调查 Meta Platforms 在非法销售毒品中所扮演的角色。【原文：U.S. federal authorities are investigating Meta Platforms for its role in the illicit sale of drugs, the Wall Street Journal newspaper reported on Saturday citing documents and people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巨无霸进入大科技领域，但也有一些小插曲
item.description: 20 世纪 40 年代麦当劳刚开业时，工人站在实体柜台前，汉堡和薯条列在纸质菜单上，顾客向人工收银员支付现金。【原文：When McDonald’s first opened for business in the 1940s, its workers stood at physical counters, its burgers and fries were listed on paper menus, and its customers paid cash to its human cashiers.】

item.title: 特斯拉将于 4 月 1 日把 Y 型车价格提高 1000 美元
item.description: 据特斯拉网站报道，特斯拉周五表示，将于4月1日将其Model Y汽车在美国的售价提高1000美元。【原文：Tesla on Friday said it will increase prices for its Model Y cars in the United States by $1,000 on April 1, according to its website.】

item.title: 美联航运营的波音 737 飞机在俄勒冈机场安全着陆，飞机外部面板丢失
item.description: 美国联合航空公司周五表示，该公司一架波音 737-800 飞机被发现外部面板缺失，已安全降落在俄勒冈州罗格谷国际梅德福德机场的预定目的地。【原文：United Airlines on Friday said one of its Boeing 737-800 aircraft was found to have a missing external panel and landed safely at its scheduled destination at Rogue Valley International Medford Airport in Oregon.】

item.title: Meta 赢得法院命令，推翻停止在巴西使用名称的裁决
item.description: Facebook 母公司 Meta 周五赢得了巴西法院的一项命令，推翻了此前因与另一家公司混淆而禁止其在南美国家使用该名称的裁决。【原文：Facebook-parent Meta on Friday won a Brazilian court order overturning a previous ruling that barred it from using the name in the South American country, due to confusion with another company.】

item.title: 消息人士称，道达尔能源公司准备重启得克萨斯州阿瑟港催化裂化中心
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies）熟悉工厂运营的人士称，该公司周五准备在周末重启德克萨斯州亚瑟港炼油厂日产 23.8 万桶汽油的流化催化裂化装置（FCC）。【原文：TotalEnergies was preparing on Friday to restart the gasoline-producing fluidic catalytic cracker (FCC) over the weekend at its 238,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) Port Arthur, Texas refinery, said people familiar with plant operations.】

item.title: 美国钢铁公司称新日铁交易有望在今年晚些时候完成
item.description: 美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel Corp）在周五提交的一份监管文件中称，新日铁的收购预计将于今年晚些时候完成。【原文：U.S. Steel Corp said in a regulatory filing on Friday that the acquisition by Nippon Steel is expected to close later this year.】

item.title: 赫兹任命吉尔-韦斯特为首席执行官
item.description: 租车公司赫兹周五表示，已任命吉尔-韦斯特（Gil West）为首席执行官，4 月 1 日起生效。【原文：Rental car firm Hertz said on Friday it has appointed Gil West as its chief executive officer, effective April 1.】

item.title: Reddit 在首次公开募股前就人工智能相关交易接受美国联邦贸易委员会调查
item.description: Reddit 周五表示，美国联邦贸易委员会正在对该公司向第三方出售、授权和分享用户生成内容以训练人工智能模型的行为进行调查。【原文：Reddit said on Friday the U.S. Federal Trade Commission is conducting an inquiry focused on the company's sale, licensing and sharing of user-generated content with third parties to train artificial intelligence models.】

item.title: 伯克希尔将巴菲特继任者格雷格-阿贝尔的薪酬提高到 2,000 万美元
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）周五表示，该公司提高了副董事长格雷格-阿贝尔（Greg Abel）的薪酬，预计他将在 2023 年接替沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）担任首席执行官。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway said on Friday it raised the pay of Vice Chairman Greg Abel, who is expected to succeed Warren Buffett as chief executive, in 2023 as the conglomerate posted a record operating profit.】

item.title: 立法者以 OnlyFans 上涉嫌滥用权力为由，呼吁加强保障措施
item.description: 路透社本周的一项调查发现，在广受欢迎的成人网站 OnlyFans 上有 140 多起关于未经同意的色情内容的警方投诉，在此之后，三名美国立法者和两名英国立法者呼吁采取更严厉的措施防止网络性剥削。【原文：Three U.S. lawmakers and two in Britain called for tougher safeguards against online sexual exploitation after a Reuters investigation this week identified more than 140 police complaints of nonconsensual pornography on OnlyFans, the popular adults-only website.】

item.title: 美国国家运输安全委员会调查得克萨斯州一起福特野马与本田 CR-V 相撞事故
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会周五表示，正在调查2月24日在得克萨斯州发生的电动福特野马SUV与本田CR-V相撞事故。【原文：The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board said on Friday it was investigating a collision between an electric-powered Ford Mustang SUV and a Honda CR-V in Texas on Feb. 24.】

item.title: 检察官称，山姆-班克曼-弗里德应因 FTX 欺诈案被判 40-50 年监禁
item.description: 检察官周五表示，山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）因从其现已破产的 FTX 加密货币交易所的客户那里窃取 80 亿美元而被定罪，应在监狱中度过 40 到 50 年。【原文：Sam Bankman-Fried should spend between 40 and 50 years in prison after being convicted for stealing $8 billion from customers of his now-bankrupt FTX cryptocurrency exchange, prosecutors said on Friday.】
